2. Myocardial infarction, commonly known as a heart attack, is a medical condition where the blood flow to a part of the heart is blocked, causing damage or death to the heart muscle. It is a serious medical emergency that can lead to severe health complications and even death.
3. Strokes, also known as cerebral infarction, occur when the blood supply to the brain is interrupted or reduced, depriving the brain of oxygen and nutrients, leading to cell death and tissue damage.
